intro: Lychnis sibirica, commonly known as Siberian campion, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Asia, including Siberia and the Himalayas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lychnis sibirica is adapted to harsh climates and can thrive in poor, well-drained soils.
